11: Write a poem about vitalya, stas, Tima, max, nikita, savin

Vitalya, Stas, Tima, Max, Nikita, Savin
Six friends so strong and true
Tying each to the others in a bond so deep and blue

Each one with a unique personality and a special way
Bringing laughter, joy, and friendship to their days

Vitalya, with her quiet strength and warm embrace
Stas, laughing and joking, bringing the group to life with grace

Tima, a steady presence, reliable and kind
Max, the life of the party, never leaving any fun behind

Nikita, a wild spirit, always looking for adventure
Savin, the wisest of all, a source of infinite wisdom to share

These six friends, together, are a force to be reckoned with
Their bond is unbreakable, a bond of friendship and love, and no one can begrudge

Verse 1:
Vitalya, he's a man of many talents
He's got a passion for life, no matter what the balance
He loves to drive his Lada, or take his BMX for a spin
And when he's feeling restless, he likes to play War Thunder and win

Chorus:
Vitalya, he's something special, for sure
With his long hair and his bright spirit, he's a picture of allure
He's a man of many charms, and his ambition's always on fire
You'll never meet another like him, that's Vitalya's desire

Verse 2:
Vitalya's always looking for a new adventure
He's never afraid to take the road less traveled
He's got a heart of gold and a spirit that never quits
And he's always willing to help when someone needs a little bit

Chorus:
Vitalya, he's something special, for sure
With his long hair and his bright spirit, he's a picture of allure
He's a man of many charms, and his ambition's always on fire
You'll never meet another like him, that's Vitalya's desire

Verse 3:
Vitalya's always pushing himself to reach new heights
He's never afraid to take a risk and step into the light
He's got a heart of gold and a strength that never fades
Vitalya, he's a man of many talents, and he's here to stay

Chorus:
Vitalya, he's something special, for sure
With his long hair and his bright spirit, he's a picture of allure
He's a man of many charms, and his ambition's always on fire
You'll never meet another like him, that's Vitalya's desire

Q: What do you call it when Vitalya and Max play War Thunder in a Lada 2103?
A: A Russian Revolution!

3: there are 4 people, I want to drink beer with them, but we cannot drink together. Explain it through set theory

Sure, I can explain it through set theory.

Let's define two sets: A and B, where A represents the set of 4 people who want to drink beer, and B represents the set of all possible groups of 4 people who can drink beer together.

Since we know that the 4 people cannot drink beer together, we can say that the intersection of sets A and B is an empty set. In other words, there are no elements in common between the two sets.

Symbolically, we can express this as A ‚à© B = ‚àÖ, where "‚à©" denotes the intersection of sets and "‚àÖ" denotes an empty set.

Therefore, it is not possible for the 4 people to drink beer together, according to set theory.

Once upon a time, there were four friends named Vitalya, Vlad, Vasya, and Vitalya 2. They had been friends since childhood and had always enjoyed spending time together. They loved to hang out, watch movies, and drink beer.

One day, they all decided to meet up at their favorite bar to catch up and have a few drinks. However, fate had other plans. As they were getting ready to leave, they received some terrible news. One of their family members had passed away, and they were all devastated.

They knew they couldn't go out and drink beer together in such a sad state, so they decided to cancel their plans. They each retreated to their own homes to mourn in their own way.

Days turned into weeks, and weeks turned into months. They all tried to keep in touch, but life kept getting in the way. Vitalya had to move away for work, Vlad got married and had a baby, Vasya fell into a deep depression, and Vitalya 2 had to take care of his sick grandmother.

As time passed, they realized that they couldn't get together to drink beer anymore. The things that once brought them together were now tearing them apart. They all missed each other terribly, but they couldn't find a way to make it work.

Years went by, and they all grew old. They each lived their own lives, but they never forgot about the bond they once shared. They often thought about the times they spent together, laughing and drinking beer.

In the end, they realized that life is unpredictable and that nothing lasts forever. They regretted not being able to get together one last time to raise a glass to their friendship. But they knew that even though they couldn't be together physically, they would always be connected by the memories they shared.
